title: Multipartition
text:
In <a href="number%20theory">number theory</a> and <a href="combinatorics">combinatorics</a>, a multipartition of a positive <a href="integer">integer</a> "n" is a way of writing "n" as a <a href="summation">sum</a>, each element of which is in turn a <a href="Partition%20%28number%20theory%29">partition</a>. The concept is also found in the theory of <a href="Lie%20algebra">Lie algebra</a>s.
r-component multipartitions.
An "r"-component multipartition of an integer "n" is an "r"-tuple of partitions λ(1)...,λ(r) where each λ("i") is a partition of some "a""i" and the "a""i" sum to "n". The number of "r"-component multipartitions of "n" is denoted "P""r"("n"). Congruences for the function "P""r"("n") have been studied by <a href="A.%20O.%20L.%20Atkin">A. O. L. Atkin</a>.
